meanings.definition: With the face or front part upward.
meanings.sent1: She placed the book faceup on the table.
meanings.sent2: The drawing was displayed faceup for everyone to see.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally glued his hand faceup to the paper.
meanings.sent4: The sunflower turned faceup towards the sky, seeking sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The cat lay faceup in the sun, enjoying the warmth on its belly.

meanings.definition: To confront or deal with a situation openly and directly.
meanings.sent1: When faced with a challenge, she decided to faceup to it bravely.
meanings.sent2: It's important to faceup to your mistakes and learn from them.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to faceup to the hecklers in the audience with humor.
meanings.sent4: She had to faceup to the fact that she couldn't do everything on her own.
meanings.sent5: The team needed to faceup to the tough competition ahead of them.
